"Spirituality and the Brain: A Revolutionary Scientific Approach to Religious Experience"

In this lecture, Dr. Wesley J. Wildman, Associate Professor of Philosophy, Theology, and Ethics at Boston University, examines traditional interpretations of religious experience in light of recent scientific models of human cognition.

This lecture is free and open to the public, and will be followed by a light reception. Part of the year-long series on religious experience sponsored by the Psychological and Religious Well-Being Project. For more information, including streaming downloads of lectures, please visit www.bu.edu/danielsen/research/trl or contact the Center for the Study of Religion & Psychology: phone: 617-358-1516, email: csrp@bu.edu.
